hints.text: A small flying passive mob
Collects and delivers items for players
Spawns near Pillager Outposts and Woodland Mansions
Can be found in dark oak cages or jail cells
Follows the player and seeks dropped items of the same type
Responds to note block sounds within 16 blocks
Cannot enter water, but attempts to gather items underwater
Regenerates health at a rate of 2♥ per second
Drops items it was holding upon death
Can be duplicated using an Amethyst Shard and a dancing Allay

spawn_conditions: Light level: Any
Biomes: Pillager Outpost, Woodland Mansion

hints.text: A passive bucketable aquatic mob
Found in lush caves and spawns near clay blocks
Comes in different colors: pink, brown, gold, cyan, and blue
Can assist players with aquatic combat and grant them Regeneration
Attacks most other aquatic mobs, except turtles, dolphins, and frogs
Can play dead to regenerate health and ignore hostile aquatic mobs
Can leave water and wander on land in search of deep water
Vulnerable to Impaling enchantment and can cause nearby pufferfish to inflate
Can be bred using buckets of tropical fish and lead
Spawns with different color variants, including leucistic and blue

spawn_conditions: Biome: Lush Caves
Clay block less than 5 blocks below spawning space

hints.text: A flying ambient passive mob
Spawns in dark areas underground
Hangs upside down on solid blocks when idle
Does not drop any items or experience upon death
Squeaks randomly and flies around aimlessly
Despawns when too far away from the player
Can fly into lava and catch on fire
Flies away if approached by a player or if its hanging block is broken
Spawns more frequently between October 20 and November 3 as an Easter egg
Collision boxes do not interact with players or redstone components

spawn_conditions: Below layer 63
Light level of 3 or less in neighboring blocks
October 20 – November 3: light level of 6 or less in neighboring blocks

hints.text: A passive mob found in villages and swamp huts
Can be tamed and used to repel creepers and phantoms
Spawns in villages with fewer than 5 cats and inside swamp huts
Comes in different variants: black, tabby, tuxedo, red, siamese, etc.
Immune to fall damage and avoids falling off cliffs
Can see players even with Invisibility status effect
Avoids and hisses at phantoms, repelling them
Creepers and phantoms avoid cats, keeping a distance
Can be tamed with raw cod or raw salmon
Teleports to the player if more than 12 blocks away

spawn_conditions: Villages with fewer than 5 cats
Swamp huts

hints.text: A passive mob found in grass biomes
Drops chicken, feathers, and eggs
Can be bred using wheat seeds, beetroot seeds, melon seeds, or pumpkin seeds
Spawns in groups on grass blocks with 2 blocks of free space above
Avoids falling off cliffs and is immune to fall damage
Follows players holding seeds
Pursued and attacked by ocelots, untamed cats, and foxes
Lays eggs every 5 to 10 minutes
Thrown eggs have a 1/8 chance of spawning a baby chicken
Baby chickens grow into adults in 20 minutes and can be accelerated with seeds

spawn_conditions: Grass blocks with 2 blocks of free space above
Light level of 9 or more

hints.text: A common bucketable aquatic mob found in oceans
Drops raw cod when killed, cooked cod if killed while on fire
Can be collected using a water bucket
Spawns in groups underwater, subject to fish spawning requirements
Weakness: Cannot survive outside of water and takes suffocation damage after 10 seconds
Can be placed in a water bucket and emptied to create a water source with swimming cod
Vulnerable to weapons with the Impaling enchantment
Sometimes drops bone meal (Java Edition) or bones (Bedrock Edition)
Can swim in water but cannot survive in waterlogged blocks
Spawns in different ocean variants, including cold, lukewarm, and deep oceans

spawn_conditions: Underwater in normal, cold, and lukewarm oceans, and their deep variants
drops: Cooked Cod (if killed while on fire)

hints.text: A passive mob found in grassy biomes
Drops leather, beef, and milk
Spawns in herds on grass blocks with space above them
Can be bred using wheat and follows players holding wheat
Avoids environmental hazards but does not avoid explosions
Can be milked using a bucket
Has a chance of spawning as a calf
Vulnerable to attacks and runs away when harmed
Drops raw beef, steak, and leather when killed
Spawns in most grassy biomes except snowy taigas and plains

spawn_conditions: Grass blocks with at least two blocks of space above them

hints.text: A variant of a horse that can be tamed and ridden
Spawns in plains, meadows, and savannas
Can be equipped with a saddle and chest
Has a foal variant that grows into an adult
Drops leather, chest, and saddle upon death
Can be tamed by repeatedly mounting it until hearts appear
Can be bred by feeding two donkeys golden apples or golden carrots
Can be used for transportation and can jump over 1.5 blocks high
Can be equipped with a chest to store items
Can follow players holding golden carrots, golden apples, or enchanted golden apples

spawn_conditions: Plains, meadows, savannas
Light level 7 or above (Bedrock Edition)

hints.text: A passive mob found in taigas and snowy taigas
Can carry a single item in its mouth, but prefers food
Has different variants: red fox and snow fox
Drops experience orbs when killed and drops items it picks up
Attacks chickens, rabbits, fish, and baby turtles
Can pounce on its prey by leaping two blocks into the air
Flees from wolves, polar bears, and players, unless the player is sneaking
Can be bred using sweet berries or glow berries
Trusting foxes defend players from certain hostile mobs
Can sleep during the day if sky light level is low

spawn_conditions: Taiga, snowy taiga, old growth taiga, grove biomes
Grass, coarse dirt, podzol, snow blocks, or top snow

hints.text: A passive mob found in swamps
Eats small slimes and magma cubes
Comes in three variants: temperate, warm, and cold
Drops 1-3 slimeballs when killed
Jumps 8 blocks high and takes reduced fall damage
Swims faster in water and can swim downwards if lured by a player
Attacks small slimes and small magma cubes, instantly despawning them
Can be bred using slimeballs
Emits croaking sounds and occasionally inflates its vocal sac

spawn_conditions: Swamp and mangrove swamp biomes
Grown from tadpoles in various biomes

hints.text: An aquatic passive mob found in dark underwater areas
Spawns in ocean depths, ravines, and underground lakes
Has an aqua luminescent texture
Wanders aimlessly in water and opens/closes its tentacles
Suffocates and dies when out of water
Does not produce light but appears to glow
Passive towards players and not attracted to light
Drops glow ink sacs and experience orbs when killed
Can't swim in lava and is affected by the Impaling enchantment
Produces crystalline particles and shoots turquoise ink when attacked

spawn_conditions: Complete darkness below layer 30 in the Overworld

hints.text: A tamable and rideable animal
Found in various biomes, including plains, savannas, and forests
Can come in different coat colors, such as black, brown, gray, and white
Can be equipped with saddles, horse armor, and chests
Can jump over fences and some other blocks
Can be bred using golden apples or golden carrots
Can be used to travel faster and carry items in the inventory
Can be healed using hay bales, apples, golden apples, or golden carrots
Can wear different types of horse armor for additional protection
Can be enchanted with various enchantments, such as Speed and Jump Boost

spawn_conditions: Various biomes: plains, savannas, forests, etc.

hints.text: A mushroom-covered variant of a cow
Spawns exclusively in mushroom fields biome
Comes in red and brown variants
Can be milked with a bucket to obtain mushroom stew
When struck by lightning, it transforms into a different color variant
Can be bred with wheat and produce offspring of different color variants
Drops leather and raw beef (steak if killed while on fire)
Can be sheared to obtain mushrooms and turn into a regular cow

spawn_conditions: Biome: Mushroom Fields
Light level: 9 or higher
On mycelium

hints.text: The offspring of a horse and a donkey
Cannot breed with other mules
Looks similar to a donkey but with darker and reddish-brown coat
Can be ridden and equipped with chests
Drops leather and any equipped chest upon death
Can be tamed and ridden for transportation
Tamed mules can be equipped with a saddle and a chest
Mules can be fed with sugar, wheat, apple, golden carrot, golden apple, or hay bale
Mules have varying health, movement speed, and jump strength
Mules cannot fit through a 1-block-wide gap

spawn_conditions: Breed a horse and a donkey
Cannot breed with other mules

hints.text: Rare passive mobs found in jungles
Spawn above grass blocks at sea level or higher
Adult ocelots have a chance to spawn with 1-2 kittens
Can attack chickens and baby turtles
Sneak and stalk their prey before chasing it down
Immune to fall damage and avoid falls
Can be tamed by feeding them raw cod or raw salmon
Tamed ocelots gain trust and no longer flee from players
Ocelots that are trusting do not despawn
Ocelots can be bred by feeding them raw cod or raw salmon

spawn_conditions: Grass blocks at sea level or higher in jungles
drops: 0-3 experience orbs (when killed by player or tamed wolf)

hints.text: A colorful and talkative avian mob
Spawns in jungle biomes
Can imitate sounds of nearby hostile mobs
Tamed with seeds and perches on the player's shoulder
Can be bred with seeds
Has different color variations: red, blue, green, cyan, and gray
Drops feathers upon death
Can ride on the player's shoulder and follow them around
Can be commanded to sit or follow
Can be healed using cookies

spawn_conditions: Biome: Jungle

hints.text: A passive mob found commonly in most grass biomes
Source of porkchops and can be equipped with a saddle
Spawns in groups above grass blocks with sufficient light
Drops raw porkchops or cooked porkchops if killed while on fire
Can be ridden with a saddle and controlled with a carrot on a stick
Follows players holding carrots, potatoes, beetroots, or a carrot on a stick
Breeds using carrots, potatoes, or beetroots
Pigs struck by lightning transform into zombified piglins

spawn_conditions: Grassy Overworld biomes with sufficient light
Spawns in animal pens, stables, and village backyards
drops: 1-3 raw porkchops (or cooked porkchops if killed while on fire)
1-3 experience orbs (if killed by player or tamed wolf)

hints.text: A bucketable aquatic mob found in oceans
Defensively inflates when approached too closely, dealing damage and inflicting Poison
Spawns in warm, lukewarm, and deep lukewarm ocean biomes in groups of 1-3
Drops 1 pufferfish when killed, unaffected by Looting
Can be collected with a water bucket, giving a bucket of pufferfish
Weaknesses: Cannot survive out of water and vulnerable to Impaling enchantment
Inflates to semi-puffed or fully puffed state, inflicting damage and Poison to nearby entities
Fully puffed pufferfish can poison for 6 seconds (Java Edition) or 10 seconds (Bedrock Edition)
Fish placed with buckets do not despawn naturally
Doesn't swim in schools like other fish

spawn_conditions: Warm, lukewarm, and deep lukewarm ocean biomes
Subject to fish spawning requirements
drops: 5% chance of dropping bone meal (Java Edition)
1-3 experience orbs (when killed by a player or tamed wolf)

hints.text: An uncommon passive mob
Spawns in various biomes, including snowy plains and flower forests
Comes in different colors, such as brown, white, black, and salt and pepper
Drops rabbit's foot, rabbit hide, and raw rabbit when killed
Can breed using carrots, golden carrots, or dandelions
Avoids players within 8 blocks and most hostile mobs within 4 blocks
Killer Bunny variant is hostile and deals high damage to players
Can eat carrot crops if mobGriefing is true
Spawns as adults with one to two babies in certain biomes

spawn_conditions: Above grass, snow blocks, or sand
Biome-specific spawns
drops: Raw rabbit (Bedrock Edition: 0-1, increased with Looting)
Raw rabbit (Java Edition: 1, increased with Looting)
Rabbit's foot (10% chance, increased with Looting)

hints.text: A common bucketable aquatic passive mob
Found in oceans, rivers, frozen oceans, and frozen rivers
Can spawn in groups of 1-5 in cold or frozen oceans and rivers
Comes in small, normal, and large sizes
Drops 1 raw salmon (cooked salmon if killed while on fire)
May drop bones or bone meal when killed
Can be collected using a water bucket
Swims in schools and can jump up waterfalls
Unable to survive out of water and suffocates when out of it
Weakness to weapons with the Impaling enchantment
Axolotls always attack this mob on sight

spawn_conditions: Biomes: River, Frozen River, Cold Ocean, Deep Cold Ocean, Frozen Ocean, Deep Frozen Ocean
Group size: 1-5 (cold or frozen oceans and rivers)
drops: Cooked salmon (if killed while on fire)
Bones (25% chance, if salmon size is small or medium)
1-3 drops upon player or tamed wolf kills
Bone meal (5% chance, Java Edition only)

hints.text: A passive farm animal
Can be found in various biomes
Can be sheared to obtain wool
Wool can be dyed in different colors
Drops mutton when killed
Can eat grass to regrow their wool
Can be bred using wheat
Occasionally spawns as a baby sheep
Can be equipped with a colored carpet as a decorative item
Can suffocate if their wool grows too long

spawn_conditions: Various biomes

hints.text: An undead variant of the horse
Sometimes spawns when lightning strikes
Spawns as part of a skeleton trap horse group
Skeleton horsemen consist of a skeleton riding a skeleton horse
Can be tamed and ridden by players
Drops bones and saddles when killed
Can jump up to five blocks high
Can be controlled by the player using a saddle
Skeleton horses have damage immunity for 3 seconds after spawning
Skeleton horses slowly regenerate health while being ridden

spawn_conditions: Spawns when lightning strikes
Part of a skeleton trap horse group

hints.text: A buildable passive mob
Throws snowballs at monsters to provoke them
Produces a trail of snow in cold biomes
Takes heat damage and dies in hot biomes
Created by placing snow blocks in an I shape and a pumpkin on top
Drops snowballs and a carved pumpkin when sheared
Wanders aimlessly and avoids water and obstacles
Attacks monsters by throwing snowballs, provoking them
Immune to damage from powder snow
Damaged by rain, water, and biomes with a temperature greater than 1.0

spawn_conditions: When created by a player, enderman, or dispenser

hints.text: A common passive aquatic mob
Spawns in rivers and oceans
Moves in three dimensions and wanders aimlessly
Suffocates when out of water for 15 seconds
Drops 1-3 ink sacs and experience orbs when killed by a player or tamed wolf
Does not attack or interact with players
Produces a cloud of black ink particles and swims away when attacked
Affected by Impaling enchantment and attacked by axolotls
Cannot swim in lava but can survive on land with Water Breathing effect
Can suffocate in air or in water only 1 block deep

spawn_conditions: Biomes: River, Ocean

hints.text: A passive mob native to the Nether
Can walk on lava and be saddled by players
Spawns in various Nether biomes
Controlled using a specific item on a stick
Drops string upon death
Can breed using a specific item
Not damaged by lava but takes damage from water, rain, and freezing
Changes appearance and behavior when outside of lava
Can be ridden by specific mobs and players
Can spawn with additional entities riding on top

spawn_conditions: Specific biomes

hints.text: A bucketable aquatic baby passive mob
Hatched from frogspawn and matures into one of three frog variants
Swims aimlessly in water and flops around on land
Hunted by axolotls and follows a player holding a slimeball
Can be picked up with a water bucket
Grows up into a frog in different biomes
Takes one Minecraft day to grow up and can be accelerated by feeding it slimeballs

spawn_conditions: Hatches from frogspawn in groups of 2-5

hints.text: A common bucketable aquatic passive mob found in oceans, mangrove swamps, and lush caves
Has 2,700 naturally occurring variants with unique colors, shapes, and names
Spawns in groups in lukewarm or warm oceans, deep variants, and lush caves
Can be collected with a water bucket and placed in water
Weakness to the Impaling enchantment, affecting other aquatic mobs as well
Tends to swim in schools with a maximum of nine tropical fish per school
Cannot survive out of water and flops around before suffocating
Drops tropical fish or bone meal when killed by a player or tamed wolf

spawn_conditions: Biomes: Mangrove Swamp, Lukewarm Ocean, Deep Lukewarm Ocean, Warm Ocean, Lush Caves
drops: 1 tropical fish (or bone meal in Java Edition)
1-3 when killed by a player or tamed wolf

hints.text: A common passive mob found in beach biomes
Only source of scutes, which drop from baby turtles when they mature
Spawns on sand in beach biomes during daylight
Moves slowly on land and can swim at a fast speed in water
Flees when attacked and tries to reach the nearest water source
Can be led by a player holding seagrass within 10 blocks
Drops seagrass when killed; increased drop with Looting enchantment
Drops a bowl when killed by lightning
Breeds by feeding two turtles seagrass; eggs are laid on nearby sand
Turtles remember their home beach and return there to lay eggs after breeding

spawn_conditions: Beach biome during daylight
Sand blocks below sea level 4
drops: 1-3 if killed by a player or tamed wolf

hints.text: A common humanoid mob found in villages
Engages in various professions, such as farmer, librarian, and blacksmith
Trades valuable items in exchange for emeralds
Can be cured from being a zombie villager using a golden apple and a potion of weakness
Breeds by sharing food with other villagers
Changes appearance based on the biome they are located in
Can be attacked by zombies and other hostile mobs
May offer discounts on trades based on reputation
Gives off green particles when healing
Emits sound effects when trading or being attacked

spawn_conditions: Village structures
Sufficient beds and job site blocks

hints.text: A passive mob that randomly spawns near the player
Appears in the Overworld with two leashed trader llamas
Sells various items, including plants, dyes, and buckets of fish
Trades with emeralds as currency and locks trades after being purchased
Can form a caravan with wild llamas
Drinks potions of invisibility and milk to renew effects
Avoids zombies, illagers, and vexes
Flees from players when attacked and llamas attack back
Does not anger iron golems when attacked or killed
Does not visually sit down when riding objects like boats and minecarts

spawn_conditions: Randomly in the Overworld within a 48-block radius of a player
May try to spawn near a claimed bell in a village (Bedrock Edition)
drops: Leads (if trader or llama dies or they are separated)
